medical_history.chief_complaint: Permanent neonatal diabetes mellitus and neonatal polycystic dysplastic kidneys due to mutation in the HNF-1/H9252 gene.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient 1 presented with diabetes at 15 days of life with severe hyperglycemia (blood sugar level of 1000 mg/dl) and metabolic acidosis, which stabilized with IV insulin therapy but resulted in ongoing diabetes requiring intermittent use of insulin. Patient 2 presented with tachypnea immediately after birth, diagnosed with renal dysfunction and end-stage renal failure by 2 years of age, requiring renal transplantation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Both patients have a history of neonatal diabetes mellitus and renal cystic diseases. Patient 1 has a slight renal abnormality with two small cysts, while Patient 2 suffered from end-stage renal failure.
medical_history.family_history: Parents showed no signs of diabetes; the mother is a low-level mosaic for the mutation.
